page.title: 11FARMING AT COMPTON FARM
page.content: Compton farm is surrounded by a few houses and a pond. It used to be a little hamlet,one is owned by Mr Langrick and the other by Mr and Mrs Nicoles.The farm covers 400 acres.The crops farmed are a variety of potatoes, winter barley, oil seed rape, grass land for hay, wheat, woodland and spring barley.The equipment they use to farm with includes, bailers, flat ape system drying equipment, storing equipment, potato harvester, 4 tractors, drills, trailers and bulk elevators. The corn goes to Kenneth Wilson Grain in Thorpe Arch. The potatoes go to factories in Kent, Scotland, Halifax and Manchester. Every year they produce 700 tons of potatoes, some go to chip factories. Some of the rape may go to Baldersbys near Ripon to dry.
